senses.definition: a person who cultivates an area of interest, such as the arts, without real commitment or knowledge.
a dish of sweetened and flavored curds of milk, often served with fruit.
examples: a junket of strawberries and cream

senses.definition: A trip or party, especially one enjoyed by an official at public expense.
examples: a lavish five-day junket to Bermuda

senses.definition: a position requiring little or no work but giving the holder status or financial benefit.
examples: political sinecures for the supporters of ministers
the church was a comfortable sinecure for the younger son of a noble family

senses.definition: the quality of being convenient and practical despite possibly being improper or immoral; convenience.
examples: the expediency of the current regime
